1. User Creation

Create a new user

Request

Method

URL            

POST

/users

Type

Params

Values

POST

POST

username

email

string

string

Response

Status

Response

401

 (empty)

 User succesfully created

400

You messed up

500

We messed up, try again later

2. Get users

Retrieve all users

Request

Method

URL            

GET

/users

Response

Status

Response

200

Response will be an object containing the list of users (array).

Each item in the user array has the following structure.

{

    "key": 10,

    "data": {

        "username": "user",

        "email": "example@provider.com"

    }

}

An example response is:-

[ {

    "key": 10,

    "data": {

        "username": "user",

        "email": "example@provider.com"

    }

},

{

    "key": 14,

    "data": {

        "username": "user2",

        "email": "example2@provider.com"

    }

}  ]

500

We messed up, please try again later

3. Get user by ID

Get a specific user by it’s ID

Request

Method

URL            

GET

/users/<id>

Type

Params

Values

URL_PARAM

User_key

<id>

number

ID

The specific id of the required user.

Response

Status

Response

200

An object containing the required user

Example response:-

{"deletions":[10,11,40], "version":"5"}

500

{"error":"Something went wrong. Please try again later."}

4. Delete user

Get more information on a particular recipe

Request

Method

URL            

DELETE

/users/<user_id>

Type

Params

Values

URL_PARAM

user_key

<user_id>

number

recipe_id

Id of the recipe you want the image of.

Response

Status

Response

200

We’re gucci

400

Glossary

Conventions

  • Client - Client application.
  • Status - HTTP status code of response.
  • All the possible responses are listed under ‘Responses’ for each method. Only one of them is issued per request server.
  • All response are in JSON format.
  • All request parameters are mandatory unless explicitly marked as [optional]
  • The type of values accepted for a request parameter are shown the the values column like this [10|<any number>] .The | symbol means OR. If the parameter is [optional], the default value is shown in blue bold text, as 10 is written in [10|<any number>].

Status Codes

All status codes are standard HTTP status codes. The below ones are used in this API.

2XX - Success of some kind

4XX - Error occurred in client’s part

5XX - Error occurred in server’s part

Status Code

Description

200

OK

201

Created

202

Accepted (Request accepted, and queued for execution)

400

Bad request

401

Authentication failure

403

Forbidden

404

Resource not found

405

Method Not Allowed

409

Conflict

412

Precondition Failed

413

Request Entity Too Large

500

Internal Server Error

501

Not Implemented

503

Service Unavailable
